cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shatterstorm
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.
cards.originalText: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Spitting Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Spend no more than {R} this way each turn.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"There are times solid ground gives precious little comfort."
—Talibah, embermage
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals to target creature damage equal to the number of mountains you control.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Talruum Minotaur
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimag, Femeref philosopher
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Vertigo
cards.text: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight
cards.originalText: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Viashino Warrior
cards.flavor:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.
cards.originalText: Flying; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Volcanic Geyser
cards.text: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
—Femeref riddle
cards.originalText: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."
—Talibah, embermage
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of a color of your choice to your mana pool.

cards.name: Call of the Wild
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Thinking of dinner made Squee realize that the forest was probably thinking the same thing.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it into play. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Cat Warriors
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, land, or enchantment.

cards.name: Dense Foliage
cards.text: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.
cards.flavor:
"Big plants not only good for hidin', but full o' tasty bugs, too."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.originalText: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.

cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands they control.
cards.flavor:
"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes,
did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard

rulings.text: The decision of whether to tap or untap is made on resolution.

cards.originalText: {3}{G}, {T}: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Elven Cache
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it there themselves.
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or Walls.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: "I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, 'Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!'"
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Fallow Earth
cards.text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Put target land on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Familiar Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor:
"I'd rather fight on foreign soil. That way, if I lose I can blame it on the terrain."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures," none of your creatures can be blocked.

cards.originalText: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature each combat.

cards.name: Femeref Archers
cards.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"They say a Zhalfirin archer can split the eye of a griffin. Nonsense, of course; they have no faith to guide their darts."
—Nuru, Femeref archer
cards.originalText: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: Creatures deal no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Brownie
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"I've been insulted by drunks in a hundred inns, but never as skillfully or annoyingly as by those blasted brownies."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}: Untap target creature.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Giant Spider can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Gorilla Chieftain
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
cards.flavor:
"In the soil of leadership sprout the seeds of immortality."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor: When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

rulings.text: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

cards.originalText: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Nature's Resurgence
cards.text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning
"all things pass"
cards.originalText: Each player draws as many cards as there are creature cards in his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Panther Warriors
cards.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

cards.name: Pradesh Gypsies
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Redwood Treefolk
cards.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: River Boa
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
cards.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText:
Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls an island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.

cards.name: Rowen
cards.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, holy avenger

rulings.text: The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

cards.originalText: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.
cards.originalText: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature each combat.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.originalText: Play up to three additional lands this turn.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Trained Armodon
cards.flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

cards.name: Tranquil Grove
cards.text: {1}{G}{G}: Destroy all other enchantments.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}{G}: Destroy all other enchantments.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Uktabi Orangutan
cards.text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
cards.originalText: When Uktabi Orangutan comes into play, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Uktabi Wildcats
cards.text:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.
cards.originalText:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.

cards.name: Unseen Walker
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"To pass through the jungle: silence, courtesy, ferocity, as the occasion demands."
—Kamau, "Proper Passage"
cards.originalText:
Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a forest.)
{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Vitalize
cards.text: Untap all creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Untap all creatures you control.

cards.name: Waiting in the Weeds
cards.text: Each player creates a 1/1 green Cat creature token for each untapped Forest they control.
cards.flavor: The trees have ears, eyes, and teeth.
cards.originalText: Each player counts the untapped forests he or she controls and puts that many 1/1 green Cat creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Warthog
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable if defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, it produces an additional {G}.

cards.name: Worldly Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.name: Wyluli Wolf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
". . . The magician drew a ring off his finger . . . , saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"
—The Arabian Nights,
Junior Classics trans.
cards.originalText: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Amber Prison
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step.
{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Amber Prison remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step.
{4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. As long as Amber Prison is tapped, that permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: Tawnos finally cracked the puzzle: the strange structures did not house Mishra's malevolent creations but were themselves among his creations.

rulings.text: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

cards.originalText: Whenever a land comes into play, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}.
cards.flavor: The Brothers' War scarred the land, but Ashnod left her mark in the bloodlines of those she tortured.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Add two colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

rulings.text: The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 Djinn artifact creature token into play. That creature has flying.

cards.name: Charcoal Diamond
cards.text:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
cards.originalText:
Charcoal Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Cursed Totem
cards.text: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
Pass me from soul to soul, / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

rulings.text: Cursed Totem does not prevent creature cards which are not on the battlefield from having their abilities activated.
Cursed Totem can prevent mana abilities from being activated.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: Players can't play activated abilities of creatures.

cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.originalText: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from play, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"How is it the legged engines seem so much more alive than their wheeled counterparts? Simply, they were born, not made."
—Mishra
cards.originalText: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dragon Mask
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor:
"With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. At end of turn, return that creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Fire Diamond
cards.text:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
cards.originalText:
Fire Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Grinning Totem
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles their library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: You may choose to find any kind of card, including a land. You must exile a card (unless the opponent's library is empty); you can't fail to find anything.

"Until the beginning of your next upkeep" means the effect wears off as soon as your next upkeep starts. Your last chance to play the card is usually the End step of the player who immediately precedes you.

The exiled card is played using the normal rules for timing and priority for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions. You'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and set that card aside. That player then shuffles his or her library. You may play the card as though it were in your hand. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played the card, put it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
cards.originalText: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that damage is dealt to you instead.

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Lead Golem
cards.text: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: Slow and heavy swings the club.
cards.originalText: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Mana Prism
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of a color of your choice to your mana pool.

cards.name: Marble Diamond
cards.text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
cards.originalText:
Marble Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.
cards.originalText: Each creature with power 3 or greater doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Put the top two cards of target player's library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Moss Diamond
cards.text:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.originalText:
Moss Diamond comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mystic Compass
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Target land is a basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship
cards.originalText: Flying
